result.title: D5.6 End-Users’ Acceptance Report
result.description: It will describe the measured user's acceptance of the BENEFFICE solutions and will derive conclusions by comparing collected baseline consumption per season (for 1 complete climatic year and in different climatic regions) with the consumption measured after applying the BENEFFICE solutions, so that major mistakes will be corrected and the analysis will yield more concrete results.

result.title: Pilot course in Data stewardship
result.description: WP2 will develop online lectures, creation of concepts for practical-skills training through student-active interdisciplinary group work, and creation of a concept for applying the gained knowledge and skills in a non-academic setting through regional assignments. More specifically, the course will introduce foundational concepts and practices underlying data stewardship. This will include the following steps in a research project: i) data search and reuse: making use of existing datasets, ii) collecting or generating new data, iii) storing, structuring, describing and analysing data, and iv) archiving and sharing data, in alignment with the FAIR data principles. The pilot course will be built according to evidence-based principles of multimedia learning, active learning and constructive alignment. Good practice elements include video lectures with embedded practice exercises, quizzes and peer assessment, all derived from clearly formulated learning outcome statements. The deliverable leader will incorporate the input from WP1 for development of course content. In addition, this deliverable will provide guidelines for the recommended workload and gained ECTS.
